data.title: NVIDIA Responds to TRC Capital’s ‘Mini-Tender’ Offer
data.description:
SANTA CLARA, Calif., Feb. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- NVIDIA has received notice of an unsolicited “mini-tender” offer by TRC Capital Investment Corporation (TRC) dated January 21, 2025, to purchase up to 1,000,000 shares of NVIDIA’s common stock at a price of $131.50 per share in cash. The offer represents less than 0.01% of NVIDIA’s outstanding common stock.

The closing of TRC’s offer is conditioned on, among other things, the trading price per share of NVIDIA’s common stock not decreasing more than 5% from the closing price per share on January 21, 2025, unless waived by TRC prior to expiration of the offer.

TRC’s offer is currently scheduled to expire one minute after 11:59 p.m., New York City time, on February 20, 2025. TRC may extend the offer, or terminate it, before the expiration date.

NVIDIA is not affiliated with TRC and does not endorse the offer documentation or the offer itself.  NVIDIA expresses no opinion and is neutral on TRC’s offer and encourages shareholders to obtain current market quotations for their shares of NVIDIA common stock, consult with their brokers or financial advisors, and exercise caution with respect to TRC’s offer.

A mini-tender offer is an offer for less than 5% of a company’s shares. It is not subject to the disclosure and procedural requirements required by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for larger tender offers. The SEC’s guidance to investors on mini-tender offers is available at https://www.sec.gov/reportspubs/investor-publications/investorpubsminitendhtm.html.

NVIDIA requests that a copy of this news release be included with all distributions of materials relating to TRC’s mini-tender offer.

About NVIDIA
NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) is the world leader in accelerated computing.

Stewart Stecker
Investor Relations
sstecker@nvidia.com

Mylene Mangalindan
Corporate Communications
press@nvidia.com

© 2025 NVIDIA Corporation. All rights reserved. NVIDIA and the NVIDIA logo are trademarks and/or registered trademarks of NVIDIA Corporation in the U.S. and other countries.

data.title: Tenant Inc. Introduces Mobile Manager and Auction Manager to Streamline Self-Storage Operations
data.description:
Tenant Inc. Introduces Mobile Manager and Auction Manager to Streamline Self-Storage Operations

Tenant Inc. Introduces Mobile Manager and Auction Manager to Streamline Self-Storage Operations

PR Newswire

NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Feb. 4, 2025

These New Features Optimize Field Management and Auction Processes for Increased Efficiency and Compliance in their Hummingbird Storage Facility Property Management Platform

NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Feb. 4, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Tenant Inc., a leading vertical SaaS platform for the self-storage industry, announces the release of two new product features: Mobile Manager and Auction Manager. Designed to address common operational challenges faced by self-storage operators, these tools enhance productivity, streamline delinquency management, and reduce compliance risks.

Introducing Mobile Manager: Empowering Field Property Managers

Self-storage property managers often face inefficiencies due to outdated, manual processes, lack of offline functionality, and fragmented tools. Mobile Manager, the mobile companion to Tenant Inc.'s Hummingbird property management software, solves these challenges by providing an integrated, mobile-first solution for field managers.

Key Features of Mobile Manager:
  • Overlock Management: Easily add and remove overlocks, whether online or offline, ensuring real-time accuracy and compliance.
  • Auction Preparation: Capture and store unit images, track delinquency tasks, and manage inventory seamlessly.
  • Offline Task Management: Work without an internet connection, with automatic syncing when reconnected to Hummingbird.
  • Enhanced Accuracy and Compliance: Reduce errors and compliance risks by replacing manual workflows with a centralized mobile solution.

"With Mobile Manager, we are giving self-storage property managers the tools they need to work efficiently in the field, eliminating reliance on disconnected systems and reducing operational bottlenecks," said Lance Watkins, CEO of Tenant Inc.

Auction Manager: Simplifying the Auction Process

Managing delinquent or abandoned units is a critical but complex process for self-storage operators. Auction Manager streamlines every stage of the auction workflow—from scheduling to payment—ensuring compliance, accuracy, and operational efficiency.

Key Features of Auction Manager:
  • Auction Scheduling: Manage online and live onsite auctions with flexible scheduling options.
  • Cut Lock and Inventory Management: Capture and track unit inventory with integrated task automation.
  • Audit Tracking: Verify every step of the auction process to ensure compliance and accuracy.
  • Auction Sale and Payment Processing: Collect bid information, process payments securely, and track transaction details.
  • Integration with Online Platforms: (Coming soon) Seamless integration with Storage Treasures for online auction publishing and sales tracking.
  • Modification and Cancellation: Adjust auction details or cancel events as needed, maintaining full control over the process.

"Auction Manager is built to simplify and optimize the auction process for self-storage operators, ensuring compliance while maximizing returns," said Justin Paquin, Director of Product at Tenant Inc.

Driving Efficiency and Innovation in the Self-Storage Industry

By introducing Mobile Manager and Auction Manager, Tenant Inc. continues to lead the self-storage technology sector with innovative solutions that directly address industry challenges. These tools enable operators to work smarter, improve operational oversight, and enhance customer service.

Availability: Mobile Manager and Auction Manager are now available as part of Tenant Inc.'s Hummingbird property management platform. For more information or to schedule a demo, visit www.tenantinc.com.

About Tenant Inc.

Tenant Inc. is a premier SaaS technology provider dedicated to the self-storage industry. Its open-architecture platform empowers operators with cutting-edge software solutions, including property management, marketing, and automation tools designed to enhance efficiency and drive profitability.

For more information, visit www.tenantinc.com.

View original content to download multimedia:https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/tenant-inc-introduces-mobile-manager-and-auction-manager-to-streamline-self-storage-operations-302368157.html

SOURCE Tenant Inc.

data.title: OMB Bank Launches OMBX, a Premier Embedded Finance Platform
data.description:
OMB Bank Launches OMBX, a Premier Embedded Finance Platform

OMB Bank proudly announces the launch of OMBX, a dedicated embedded finance division designed to empower fintechs and other digital companies with seamless banking solutions. With seven fintech clients already operating and several more in its pipeline, OMBX is positioned to become a premier embedded finance partner within the industry.

This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250204484196/en/

Steve Bishop is the chief innovation officer for OMB Bank and president of OMBX, the bank's recently launched dedicated embedded finance division. (Photo: Business Wire)

The launch of a dedicated website at www.ombx.com marks a significant step in OMBX’s mission to provide clients with a scalable and compliant banking infrastructure. By combining cutting-edge technology with a banking partner that understands the fintech ecosystem, OMBX simplifies financial integration for innovators looking to embed financial products into their platforms.

“Embedded finance is revolutionizing the way businesses and consumers interact with banking services," said Steve Bishop, president of OMBX and OMB Bank’s chief innovation officer. "With OMBX, we are meeting this demand head-on, offering clients a powerful banking partnership that delivers security, scalability and compliance, allowing them to focus on building transformative financial products.”

The embedded finance market continues to experience explosive growth, with global revenue projections reaching over $500 billion by 2029. OMBX is committed to positioning itself as a leader in this space, offering a seamless integration process, compliance support, fraud prevention, payment processing and robust analytics tools.

“OMBX represents the next evolution of OMB Bank's commitment to innovation and financial technology,” said Mark Harrington, president and CEO of OMB Bank. “By launching this brand, we are strengthening our position as a trusted financial partner for fintechs and others, helping them navigate the complexities of embedded banking while delivering exceptional value to their customers.”

OMBX’s launch solidifies OMB Bank’s vision of becoming a go-to embedded finance partner, enabling clients to scale quickly and securely. With the growing demand for integrated banking solutions, OMBX is set to play a crucial role in shaping the future of financial technology.

About OMBX

OMBX is the embedded finance division of OMB Bank, providing alternative banking solutions including payment processing, compliance, fraud prevention and analytics. OMBX is designed to help fintechs and others scale efficiently while ensuring security, compliance and a best-in-class financial infrastructure. Please visit www.ombx.com for more information.

About OMB Bank

Founded in 1999, OMB Bank is committed to making banking better for families, businesses and communities with its best-in-class consumer, commercial, treasury, mortgage and digital banking services. OMB is headquartered in Springfield, Mo., and operates nine branch locations across Southwest Missouri and the greater Kansas City metropolitan area as well as dedicated mortgage and commercial lending centers in Springfield. Please visit www.ombbank.com for more information.

Ryan Bowling
Director of Marketing
r.bowling@ombbank.com
(888) 662-2443
ombbank.com

View source version on businesswire.com: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250204484196/en/

data.title: Allied Water Services Announces Strategic Partnership with Norweco to Supply High-Quality Septic Tanks to Industry Professionals
data.description:
Allied Water Services Announces Strategic Partnership with Norweco to Supply High-Quality Septic Tanks to Industry Professionals

Allied Water Service, a leader in septic, sewer & waterproofing solutions, is proud to announce an exclusive partnership with Norweco, a globally recognized manufacturer of advanced wastewater treatment systems. Through this collaboration, Allied Water Services will serve as a premier distributor of Norweco’s high-quality aerobic treatment units (ATU), catering exclusively to septic installation companies and wastewater professionals.

This partnership aligns with Allied Water Services’ mission to provide industry-leading septic solutions that enhance system longevity, efficiency, and environmental sustainability for both residential and commercial properties. By offering Norweco’s cutting-edge advance aerobic treatment technology, septic professionals can now access superior products that meet modern wastewater treatment demands.

Meeting the Growing Demand for High-Performance Septic Systems

With increasing regulatory standards and environmental concerns surrounding wastewater treatment, septic companies must rely on systems that deliver both performance and compliance. Norweco’s treatment units are engineered for durability, reliability, and advanced treatment capabilities, making them the ideal choice for contractors and sewage installation experts seeking top-tier products.

“Partnering with Norweco allows us to bring the best in septic technology directly to the professionals who need it most,” said Jennifer Mrdalj, CEO at Allied Water Services. “By supplying these high-quality tanks, we aim to help septic businesses improve their service offerings while ensuring long-term wastewater management solutions for their clients.”

Benefits for Septic Companies

Through this distribution partnership, septic businesses will gain access to:

  • Premium Norweco septic tanks built for superior treatment performance and longevity.
  • Exclusive bulk purchasing options for installation professionals.
  • Industry-leading customer support and technical guidance.
  • Competitive pricing and financing solutions for business growth.

How to Purchase Norweco Septic Tanks

Septic contractors and wastewater professionals interested in purchasing Norweco septic tanks through Allied Water Services can contact our sales team for pricing and availability. Orders can be placed by visiting www.awspro.us or by reaching out to support@awspro.us

About Allied Water Services

Founded in 2019, Allied Water Services specializes in comprehensive septic, sewer, and waterproofing solutions. Unlike companies that focus on individual services, we take a holistic approach—integrating waterproofing, septic systems, stormwater management, and site utilities into seamless, long-lasting solutions.

Our expertise in technical areas such as septic installations, stormwater management, and complex site utilities allows us to adapt to challenging conditions, delivering tailored strategies that align with client needs. By partnering with leading suppliers, we provide access to top-quality materials and the latest technology, ensuring durable, compliant infrastructure that not only meets immediate project demands but also enhances long-term sustainability and minimizes maintenance costs.

Allied Water Services
Jennifer Mrdalj
815-735-5586
jennifer@awspro.us
www.awspro.us

data.title: Materials Gain on Trade-Negotiation Hopes - Materials Roundup
data.description:
Producers of metals and other raw materials rose amid optimism about China's relatively limited response to sweeping U.S. tariffs.

In a coordinated action, several Chinese government bodies announced actions targeting U.S. goods and companies at 1:02 p.m. local time, one minute after the U.S. formally increased tariffs on imports of all Chinese-made goods by an additional 10%.

China imposed 15% tariffs on U.S. coal and liquefied natural gas imports, while raising levies on crude oil, agricultural machinery and certain vehicles, though some economists said Beijing acted with a restraint that indicated Xi Jinping was open to negotiation.

"There is...speculation that these tariff announcements may all just be part of a broader strategy to negotiate key diplomatic objectives and will only prove to be short-lived," said Kristin Kerr, head of macro strategy for brokerage LPL Financial, in a note to clients.

"It is a lot to work through, and this intricate combination of dynamic factors will likely create some macroeconomic volatility in the short term as the true duration, scope, and ultimate impact of these new policies remains unclear," Kerr said.

Gold futures, which investors sometimes seek out in terms of intensified geopolitical risk, rose to record highs, topping $2870 an ounce.

Grain-processing giant Archer Daniels Midland said its fourth-quarter profit fell 9% to $667 million, as it issued a cautious outlook for 2025 and said it would cut up to 700 jobs to reduce expenses.

Gold futures rise, having set a fresh record slightly earlier in the session. 




  Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com 



  (END) Dow Jones Newswires



  February 04, 2025 17:41 ET (22:41 GMT)


Copyright (c) 2025 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

data.title: Energy Rises on Iran Reports - Energy Roundup
data.description:
Shares of energy companies rose amid reports of renewed pressure on Iran from the Trump administration.

Oil futures were sliding, testing the $70 per barrel level until reports hit the tape that President Trump would sign an executive order aimed at preventing Iran from acquiring nuclear weapons.

Hopes that President Donald Trump was seeking to force trading partners to the negotiating table with tariffs also supported energy stocks, despite a selloff in oil futures.

The U.S. raised tariffs on all Chinese imports by 10%. Beijing said it would impose 15% tariffs on supercooled natural gas and coal from the U.S. as part of its response to Trump's new levies.

Natural-gas futures fell, as analysts at research firm NatGasWeather.com said the impact of the tariffs was currently hard to gauge.

Australian oil-and-gas producer OMV said its fourth-quarter net profit jumped despite weak refining margins. 




  Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com 



  (END) Dow Jones Newswires



  February 04, 2025 17:41 ET (22:41 GMT)


Copyright (c) 2025 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

data.title: AMD comes up short in a key segment - and that's pressuring its stock
data.description:
By Emily Bary

While AMD's PC business beat expectations, its data-center business, which includes AI accelerators, missed the mark

Advanced Micro Devices Inc. beat expectations with its overall revenue for the latest quarter - and with its outlook for the current one.

So why is the stock down 4% in Tuesday's extended session? Investors might be disappointed by the source of the beat and what it says about momentum for AMD (AMD) in the data center.

While AMD's data-center business rose 69% to a record $3.9 billion for the latest quarter, that wasn't enough to clear Wall Street's bar. Analysts tracked by FactSet had been projecting $4.1 billion.

Analysts had been growing more concerned about AMD's data-center trajectory ahead of the report. Wolfe Research analyst Chris Caso lowered his AI revenue expectations last month, saying he expected about $7 billion in revenue from that part of the business this year. He previously was modeling at least $10 billion.

See also: AMD's stock downgraded yet again: 'Believe it or not, it's not due to DeepSeek'

AMD didn't offer a forecast for 2025 AI revenue in its latest release. The data-center unit also includes revenue from traditional sources unrelated to AI.

Chief Executive Lisa Su said in prepared remarks posted to the company's site that its recent progress "places AMD on a steep long-term growth trajectory, led by the rapid scaling of our data-center AI franchise from more than $5 billion of revenue in 2024 to tens of billions of dollars of annual revenue over the coming years."

AMD also cheered developments related to DeepSeek, the Chinese AI startup, and Stargate, the U.S. joint venture focused on AI infrastructure. "All of these initiatives require massive amounts of new compute and create unprecedented growth opportunities for AMD across our businesses," the company said.

For the latest quarter, the big source of upside was revenue from its client business, which includes personal computers. Sales there rose 58% to $2.3 billion. The FactSet consensus was for $1.9 billion.

The gaming and embedded businesses both saw drops in revenue, reflecting sustained pressures there. Gaming revenue was down 59% to $563 million, with AMD noting a drop in semi-custom sales. And the company pointed to "mixed" end-market demand for its embedded unit, which saw revenue fall 13% to $923 million.

Overall, AMD delivered $7.7 billion in revenue versus the $7.5 billion consensus view. And the company is looking for $7.1 billion in revenue during the current quarter, based on the midpoint of its guidance range. Analysts tracked by FactSet had been modeling $7.0 billion.

"Looking into 2025, we see clear opportunities for continued growth based on the strength of our product portfolio and growing demand for high-performance and adaptive computing," Su said in a release.

-Emily Bary

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal. 




  (END) Dow Jones Newswires



  02-04-25 1725ET


Copyright (c) 2025 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

data.title: BankUnited Names New Executive Vice President to Lead Business Banking in Florida and Texas Markets
data.description:
BankUnited Names New Executive Vice President to Lead Business Banking in Florida and Texas Markets

BankUnited Inc. (NYSE: BKU) announced it has named Lynetta Tipton Steed as executive vice president, head of business banking for the Florida and Texas markets.

This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250204891393/en/

Lynetta Tipton Steed, BankUnited Executive Vice President, Head of Business Banking for Florida and Texas (Photo: Business Wire)

Steed will be responsible for developing, managing and advancing strategic objectives for BankUnited’s business banking teams, including guiding efforts to increase the company’s already strong business banking loan portfolio. She will also work closely with BankUnited’s commercial banking teams.

“Lynetta is a proven leader and relationship builder who has consistently grown revenues and helped business customers achieve their goals,” said Ernie Diaz, BankUnited’s senior executive vice president, consumer & commercial/small business. “She will take our business banking in Florida and Texas to even higher levels of success.”

Steed is a seasoned executive with more than 35 years of banking experience. Her business banking background includes serving as executive vice president for Regions Bank, responsible for sales and service excellence and the revenue growth strategy for the business banking and community banking lines of business. She also served as business banking executive for Fifth Third Bank over Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, North Carolina and Tennessee.

She is a current member and past chairperson of the Consumer Banker Association’s Small Business Committee-Washington, D.C. In this role, Steed testified before the U.S. House of Representatives’ Small Business Committee. She will be based in Orlando at 189 Orange Avenue, Suite 1270 S, Orlando, Florida 32801. For more information, call (407) 260-7921 or visit www.BankUnited.com.

About BankUnited, N.A.

BankUnited, Inc. (NYSE: BKU), with total assets of $35.2 billion at December 31, 2024, is the bank holding company of BankUnited, N.A., a national bank headquartered in Miami Lakes, Florida that provides a full range of banking and related services to individual and corporate customers through banking centers located in the state of Florida, New York metropolitan area and Dallas, Texas, and a comprehensive suite of wholesale products to customers through an Atlanta office focused on the Southeast region. BankUnited also offers certain commercial lending and deposit products through national platforms. For additional information, call (877) 779-2265 or visit www.BankUnited.com. BankUnited can be found on Facebook at facebook.com/BankUnited.official , LinkedIn @BankUnited and on X @BankUnited.

Donna Crump-Butler, (305) 231-6707
dbutler@BankUnited.com

data.title: Sun Communities, Inc. Investors: Please contact the Portnoy Law Firm to recover your losses. February 10, 2025 Deadline to file Lead Plaintiff Motion
data.description:
Investors can contact the law firm at no cost to learn more about recovering their losses

LOS ANGELES, Feb. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) --  The Portnoy Law Firm advises Sun Communities, Inc. ("Sun Communities, Inc." or the "Company") (NYSE: SUI) investors of a class action representing investors that bought securities between February 28, 2019 and September 24, 2024, inclusive (the "Class Period"). Sun Communities, Inc. investors have until February 10, 2025 to file a lead plaintiff motion.

Investors are encouraged to contact attorney Lesley F. Portnoy, by phone 310-692-8883 or email: lesley@portnoylaw.com, to discuss their legal rights, or click here to join the case. The Portnoy Law Firm can provide a complimentary case evaluation and discuss investors’ options for pursuing claims to recover their losses.

According to the complaint, the defendants provided investors with critical information regarding SUI’s accounting practices and internal controls over financial reporting. On September 24, 2024, after the market closed, an investment research report raised concerns about the integrity of SUI’s Board, as well as the company’s governance, controls, and financial disclosures. This revelation prompted an immediate reaction from investors and analysts. As a result, SUI’s stock price experienced a sharp decline. From a closing price of $139.10 per share on September 24, 2024, the stock dropped to a low of $137.48 per share on September 25, 2024.

Please visit our website to review more information and submit your transaction information.

The Portnoy Law Firm represents investors in pursuing claims against caused by corporate wrongdoing. The Firm’s founding partner has recovered over $5.5 billion for aggrieved investors. Attorney advertising. Prior results do not guarantee similar outcomes.

Lesley F. Portnoy, Esq.
Admitted CA and NY Bar
lesley@portnoylaw.com
310-692-8883
www.portnoylaw.com

data.title: INVESTOR DEADLINE NEXT WEEK: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP Announces that Enphase Energy, Inc. Investors with Substantial Losses Have Opportunity to Lead Class Action Lawsuit - ENPH
data.description:
SAN DIEGO, Feb. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The law firm of Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP announces that purchasers or acquirers of Enphase Energy, Inc. (NASDAQ: ENPH) common stock between April 25, 2023 and October 22, 2024, inclusive (the “Class Period”), have until Tuesday, February 11, 2025 to seek appointment as lead plaintiff of the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit. Captioned The Trustees of the Welfare and Pension Funds of Local 464A - Pension Fund v. Enphase Energy, Inc., No. 24-cv-09038 (N.D. Cal.), the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit charges Enphase Energy as well as certain of Enphase Energy’s top executives with violations of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

If you suffered substantial losses and wish to serve as lead plaintiff of the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit, please provide your information here:

https://www.rgrdlaw.com/cases-enphase-energy-class-action-lawsuit-enph.html

You can also contact attorneys J.C. Sanchez or Jennifer N. Caringal of Robbins Geller by calling 800/449-4900 or via e-mail at info@rgrdlaw.com.

CASE ALLEGATIONS: Enphase Energy designs, develops, manufactures, and sells home energy solutions for the solar photovoltaic industry.

The Enphase Energy class action lawsuit alleges that defendants throughout the Class Period made false and/or misleading statements and/or failed to disclose that defendants systematically overstated Enphase Energy’s ability to maintain its pricing levels and market share for microinverter products in Europe in the face of competition from low-cost, Chinese alternatives.

The Enphase Energy class action lawsuit further alleges that on October 26, 2023, Enphase Energy announced that third quarter 2023 “revenue in Europe decreased approximately 34%, compared to the second quarter of 2023 due to . . . softening in demand in our key markets – the Netherlands, France, and Germany.” On this news, the price of Enphase Energy common stock fell nearly 15%, according to the complaint.

Then, the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit further alleges that on October 22, 2024 Enphase Energy announced its third quarter 2024 financial results and revealed that “revenue in Europe decreased approximately 15% for the third quarter of 2024, compared to the second quarter of 2024” due to “further softening in European demand.” On this news, the price of Enphase Energy common stock fell nearly 15%, according to the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit.

THE LEAD PLAINTIFF PROCESS: The Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 permits any investor who purchased or acquired Enphase Energy common stock during the Class Period to seek appointment as lead plaintiff in the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit. A lead plaintiff is generally the movant with the greatest financial interest in the relief sought by the putative class who is also typical and adequate of the putative class. A lead plaintiff acts on behalf of all other class members in directing the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit. The lead plaintiff can select a law firm of its choice to litigate the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit. An investor’s ability to share in any potential future recovery is not dependent upon serving as lead plaintiff of the Enphase Energy class action lawsuit.

ABOUT ROBBINS GELLER: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP is one of the world’s leading law firms representing investors in securities fraud cases. Our Firm has been #1 in the ISS Securities Class Action Services rankings for six out of the last ten years for securing the most monetary relief for investors. We recovered $6.6 billion for investors in securities-related class action cases – over $2.2 billion more than any other law firm in the last four years. With 200 lawyers in 10 offices, Robbins Geller is one of the largest plaintiffs’ firms in the world and the Firm’s attorneys have obtained many of the largest securities class action recoveries in history, including the largest securities class action recovery ever – $7.2 billion – in In re Enron Corp. Sec. Litig. Please visit the following page for more information:

https://www.rgrdlaw.com/services-litigation-securities-fraud.html

Past results do not guarantee future outcomes. 
Services may be performed by attorneys in any of our offices. 

Contact:
        Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP
        J.C. Sanchez, Jennifer N. Caringal
        655 W. Broadway, Suite 1900, San Diego, CA 92101
        800-449-4900
        info@rgrdlaw.com
